title: The Road to $1,000,000 Bitcoin - Bitcointalk Forum Discussions

overview: A comprehensive analysis of Bitcoin's journey from $5 to $1,000,000, covering mining evolution, market psychology, and long-term investment strategies as discussed on Bitcointalk forums

van_kush_position.backing_model: Good cloud mining uses Ad Revenue or E-commerce to back currency

main_arguments: 99% of cloud mining is Ponzi scheme
Operators Paradox: Why sell hashrate for less than BTC it produces?
If profitable, market would be flooded with legitimate providers

operators_paradox.scenario_1: Sell hashrate for MORE than BTC value = Customer loses
operators_paradox.scenario_2: Sell hashrate for LESS than BTC value = Operator loses
operators_paradox.conclusion: Mathematical impossibility for sustained profit on both sides

van_kush_defense.counter_argument: Generalizing is a mistake - like calling Bitcoin dead at $20k
